workflow.name: üë≤ Monitor & debug n8n workflows with Claude AI assistant and MCP server
workflow.description:
***Tags**: AI Agent, MCP Server, n8n API, Monitoring, Debugging, Workflow Analytics, Automation*

### Context

Hi! I‚Äôm [Samir](https://samirsaci.com) ‚Äî a Supply Chain Engineer and Data Scientist based in Paris, and founder of [LogiGreen Consulting](https://logi-green.com).

This workflow is part of my latest project: an **AI assistant that automatically analyses n8n workflow executions, detects failures, and identifies root causes** through natural conversation with Claude Desktop.

[![Concept](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/2025/11/image-2.png)](https://youtu.be/oJzNnHIusZs)

> Turn your automation logs into intelligent conversations with an AI that understands your workflows.

The idea is to use *Claude Desktop* to help monitor and debug your workflows deployed in production.

The workflow shared here is part of the setup.

üì¨ For business inquiries, you can find me on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/samir-saci)

### Who is this template for?

This template is designed for **automation engineers**, **data professionals**, and **AI enthusiasts** who manage multiple workflows in **n8n** and want a smarter way to track errors or performance without manually browsing execution logs.

If you‚Äôve ever discovered a failed workflow hours after it happened ‚Äî this is for you.


### What does this workflow do?

This workflow acts as the **bridge** between your n8n instance and the **Claude MCP Server**.

[![Principle](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/size/w1000/2025/11/image-1.png)](https://youtu.be/oJzNnHIusZs)

It exposes three main routes that can be triggered via a webhook:

1. `get_active_workflows` ‚Üí Fetches all currently active workflows  
2. `get_workflow_executions` ‚Üí Retrieves the latest executions and calculates health KPIs  
3. `get_execution_details` ‚Üí Extracts detailed information about failed executions for debugging  

Each request is automatically routed and processed, providing Claude with structured execution data for real-time analysis.

### How does it fit in the overall setup?

Here‚Äôs the complete architecture:
```
Claude Desktop ‚Üê‚Üí 
   MCP Server ‚Üê‚Üí 
      n8n Monitor Webhook ‚Üê‚Üí
         n8n API
```

- The **MCP Server** (Python-based) communicates with your n8n instance through this workflow.  
- The **Claude Desktop app** can then query workflow health, execution logs, and error patterns using natural language.  
- The **n8n workflow** aggregates, cleans, and returns the relevant metrics (failures, success rates, timing, alerts).

üìò The full concept and architecture are explained in my article published on my blog:  
üëâ [Deploy your AI Assistant to Monitor and Debug n8n Workflows using Claude and MCP](https://towardsdatascience.com/deploy-your-ai-assistant-to-monitor-and-debug-n8n-workflows-using-claude-and-mcp)

### üé• Tutorial

The full setup tutorial (with source code and demo) is available on YouTube:

[![Tutorial + Demo](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/2025/11/temp-8.png)](https://youtu.be/oJzNnHIusZs)

### How does it work?

- üåê Webhook Trigger receives the MCP server requests  
- üîÄ Switch node routes actions based on `"action"` parameter  
- ‚öôÔ∏è HTTP Request nodes fetch execution and workflow data via the n8n API  
- üßÆ A Code node calculates KPIs (success/failure rates, timing, alerts)  
- üì§ The processed results are returned as JSON for Claude to interpret

### Example use cases

Once connected, you can ask Claude questions like:
- ‚ÄúShow me all workflows that failed in the last 25 executions.‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúWhy is my `Bangkok Meetup Scraper` workflow failing?‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúGive me a health report of my n8n instance.‚Äù  

[![Example](https://www.samirsaci.com/content/images/size/w1000/2025/11/image-3.png)](https://youtu.be/oJzNnHIusZs)

Claude will reply with structured insights, including failure patterns, node diagnostics, and health status indicators (üü¢üü°üî¥).

### What do I need to get started?

You‚Äôll need:
- A **self-hosted n8n instance**
- **Claude Desktop** app installed
- The **MCP server source code** (shared in the tutorial description)
- The **webhook URL** from this workflow is configured in your `.env` file  

Follow the tutorial for more details, don't hesitate to leave your questions in the comment section.

### Next Steps

üóíÔ∏è Use the sticky notes inside the workflow to:
- Replace <YOUR_N8N_INSTANCE> with your own URL  
- Test the webhook routes individually using the ‚ÄúExecute Workflow‚Äù button  
- Connect the MCP server and Claude Desktop to start monitoring  

*This template was built using n8n v.116.2*  
*Submitted: November 2025*

parameters.content:
## Workflow Monitoring Endpoint 

### How it works
This workflow, combined with a local MCP Server will help you to monitor any n8n instance health through API endpoints. 

Based on the action selected in the body request received by the webhook, it triggers different queries to get **execution metrics**, **workflow statuses**, and **failure analysis**. 
- `get_active_workflows` ‚Üí List all active workflows
- `get_workflow_executions` ‚Üí Fetch the latest workflow runs 
- `get_execution_details` ‚Üí Retrieve all failed executions for a workflow

### Setup steps  
- [ ] Replace `<YOUR_N8N_INSTANCE>` in all HTTP nodes with your instance URL
- [ ] Configure n8n API credentials for authentication  
- [ ] Set `limit` and `workflow_id` in request body as needed
- [ ] Set up the local MCP Server following the instructions of the tutorial

### Customization
You can modify the `Processing Audit` node to adjust failure thresholds (currently set at 10% triggers alerts) or add custom KPIs for your monitoring needs.

*If you have any question, feel to leave a comment in the video!*

## 1. Webhook Entry with a switch by action
Receives POST requests with action parameter to route monitoring requests
## 2. Get last executions logs and process them
## 3. Get all the active workflows of the instance
## 4. Get the detailed executions logs for a specific workflow
